site_name: 56 Butts Green Road, Creative Kids Nurseries
decision_conditions: It is recommended that this Pine tree T7 as shown on the Havering TPO plan 8/91 can have the roots pruned to help alleviate the block paving lifting and causing a trip hazard.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The applicant is required to give 7 working days notice of when the work for which consent is granted is to be carried out.
To give the council the opportunity to make arrangements to supervise the work.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.

Tree Officer (T Goldrick) to attend site to view exposed root system and agree on site with contractor the roots that can be pruned to facilitate the re-laying of the block paving to stop trip hazard.
description: Large tree at front of property needs some work on the root system as it is raising the block paving in a number of areas. Pine tree is making a tripping hazard in the car park
